verses.verse: The word <S%H1697><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%> that <S%H834><s%> came <S%H1961><s%> to <S%H413><s%> Jeremiah <S%H3414><s%> the prophet <S%H5030><s%> against <S%H413><s%> the Philistines, <S%H6430><s%> before <S%H2962><s%> that Pharaoh <S%H6547><s%> smote <S%H5221><s%> <S%H853><s%> Gaza. <S%H5804><s%>

Thus <S%H3541><s%> saith <S%H559><s%> the LORD; <S%H3068><s%> Behold, <S%H2009><s%> waters <S%H4325><s%> rise up <S%H5927><s%> out of the north, <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6828><s%> and shall be <S%H1961><s%> an overflowing <S%H7857><s%> flood, <S%H5158><s%> and shall overflow <S%H7857><s%> the land, <S%H776><s%> and all <S%H4393><s%> that is therein; the city, <S%H5892><s%> and them that dwell <S%H3427><s%> therein: then the men <S%H120><s%> shall cry, <S%H2199><s%> and all <S%H3605><s%> the inhabitants <S%H3427><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> shall howl. <S%H3213><s%>

At the noise <S%H4480><s%> <S%H6963><s%> of the stamping <S%H8161><s%> of the hooves <S%H6541><s%> of his strong <S%H47><s%> horses, at the rushing <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7494><s%> of his chariots, <S%H7393><s%> and at the rumbling <S%H1995><s%> of his wheels, <S%H1534><s%> the fathers <S%H1><s%> shall not <S%H3808><s%> look back <S%H6437><s%> to <S%H413><s%> their children <S%H1121><s%> for feebleness <S%H4480><s%> <S%H7510><s%> of hands; <S%H3027><s%>

Because of <S%H5921><s%> the day <S%H3117><s%> that cometh <S%H935><s%> to spoil <S%H7703><s%> <S%H853><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> the Philistines, <S%H6430><s%> and to cut off <S%H3772><s%> from Tyrus <S%H6865><s%> and Zidon <S%H6721><s%> every <S%H3605><s%> helper <S%H5826><s%> that remaineth: <S%H8300><s%> for <S%H3588><s%> the LORD <S%H3068><s%> will spoil <S%H7703><s%> <S%H853><s%> the Philistines, <S%H6430><s%> the remnant <S%H7611><s%> of the country <S%H339><s%> of Caphtor. <S%H3731><s%>

Baldness <S%H7144><s%> is come <S%H935><s%> upon <S%H413><s%> Gaza; <S%H5804><s%> Ashkelon <S%H831><s%> is cut off <S%H1820><s%> with the remnant <S%H7611><s%> of their valley: <S%H6010><s%> how long <S%H5704><s%> <S%H4970><s%> wilt thou cut thyself? <S%H1413><s%>

O <S%H1945><s%> thou sword <S%H2719><s%> of the LORD, <S%H3068><s%> how long <S%H5704><s%> <S%H575><s%> will it be ere <S%H3808><s%> thou be quiet? <S%H8252><s%> put up thyself <S%H622><s%> into <S%H413><s%> thy scabbard, <S%H8593><s%> rest, <S%H7280><s%> and be still. <S%H1826><s%>

How <S%H349><s%> can it be quiet, <S%H8252><s%> seeing the LORD <S%H3068><s%> hath given it a charge <S%H6680><s%> against <S%H413><s%> Ashkelon, <S%H831><s%> and against <S%H413><s%> the sea <S%H3220><s%> shore? <S%H2348><s%> there <S%H8033><s%> hath he appointed <S%H3259><s%> it.
